Reviews.Title: “For those who want to stay near Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: daisy2011
Reviews.Content: It is very nice hotel for short stay. We spent just one night there and were satisfied with it. The location is great, not far from metro station, close to Hospital de Sant Pau and Sagrada Familia. It’s very convenient for those who want to see Sagrada. The room was clean, modern and light. The bathroom is large with all facilities. The price was reasonable. We paid 40 Euros for a double room per night. The only minus is that the woman at the reception did not speak English at all and did not even want to understand us. In general the hotel is nice for one night. For long stay in Barcelona I would recommend to take hotel in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Everest is next to the Hospital Sant Pau, in a quieter area of Barcelona, but it's convenient to the Metro and a short walk to Sagrada Familia. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the price right. The hotel is on the 6th floor but has an elevator. A great, inexpensive place to stay for a short stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a one or tow night stay over”
Reviews.Author: Eenie9
Reviews.Content: This is a unique hotel where the rooms are clean modern and we had a balcony overlooking that part of the City. We were near the Familia de Sagrada where we found the Off and On buses A great way to see the City, The bathrooms were just fine with plenty of hot water. Four of us friends stayed there for just one night and we all thought it was a place we would highly recommend. we only wish we could have stayed another day in the beautiful City. The directions to get there were a little vague but with the help of strangers were able to find it. the street is right across from the Hotel santa Creu de Sant Paul.

Reviews.Title: “More a B&B (but without the Breakfast) than a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Selloy
Reviews.Content: Located near the Sant Pau Hospital, this hotel is quite good for sleeping. The room was clean and the only problem was the termoacumulador that was not enough for 2 people taking a quick hot bath. Despite that it was a good experience but don’t expect any kind of luxuries and it’s not really close from the Ramblas but “Avenida de Gaudi” is a pretty avenue and really calm.

Reviews.Title: “Love Barcelona,Hate the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Singa-purr
Reviews.Content: It was a terrible introduction to Barcelona as we arrived late at night. We found that the room was not properly made up, no bath towels or toilet paper and soap and the management couldnt communicate in English. It was exasperating. On top of that, the door to the roof top balcony was faulty and could not lock! We had to push the table against the door for security. We did try to change the room the next day but found it so difficult to communicate with them as nobody spoke English. Five members of the management we have encountered and none understood what we were trying to say despite us using a phrasebook. On top of that when we checked out, they conveniently said their credit card machine was broken and asked for cash instead. What more, we found another hotel which was nearer to Ramblas, a boutique hotel of the same price with breakfast.! We felt overcharged in Everest H.
